reviewer_info: Annie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Consumer)
comment:
I suffered for years with a terrible breakout on my tush.  always the same place.  I never mentioned it to my doctor.  Just treated it with a mixture of drawing salve, cortisone and triple antibiotic.  Then dressed it with a bandage to keep from scratching.  If would reappear from time to time.  Once it felt worse than ever, so I used my phone to make pictures..  Oh dear, this was like nothing  I was familiar with.  I had an appointment with my doc the next day.  I showed him the pix.  He said that is herpes.  I was shocked and mortified.  I jumped up and pulled down my pants and showed him my many blisters all clustered together.  We decided to treat it when I had a breakout with an antiviral.  It only helped a little.  I did research and found a possible solution.  I started taking 2 famcyclovire at first sign of trouble and using imiquidone cream for several days.  Results were astounding, but still frequent breakouts.  I had bought DMSO (vet supply) for my hubby who was critically ill and was having many bladder infections associated with MS.  Desperate measures call for desperate acts.  He was already using colllodial silver so I gave it to him together with d-mannose(for UIs).
After what I had read I was willing to try it.  Next breakout of herpes I took the famvir and a quarter spoon of DMSO i also mixed DMSO with the imiquidone.  Blessed be.  The breakout cleared up in a hurry.  I did not have another one for about 5 or 6 months.  When I did have one just starting, I repeated my treatment.    Have not had another one in a year.  It WORKS.

reviewer_info: GR Bygosh, 55-64 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment: I had heard of DMSO as an animal treatment for soreness and then there was a big controversy in the 80's since it was being used by people with joint pain and arthritis. It was not "USDA approved" etc. I got some 15 years ago because I had pain from congenital spinal degeneration and of course an increase in severe  back pain. To me, it didn't really work for that (difficult to apply). But now I have severe arthritic joint pain too and it definitely works for that, for me. For the back, one thing that really worked and got me mobile was acupuncture. That was last year (2015) and it was really amazing after just wanting to lay down all the time, in pain. I'm quite physical etc. To stay that way is critical at my age. But the DMSO I would use externally and it goes thru the skin. Yes, it may irritate skin so use a lower % (I use 99%) from DMSO, Inc. but it's sold by many other companies and don't pay very much for it. If it's a good enough topical for a horse, I'm fine with it. I wouldn't ever take DMSO internally though unless prescribed. One other ointment that works ok is Tri-Flora by Boericke

reviewer_info: ThousandSuns, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment:
I've used DMSO with wounds on my skin caused by steroids, prescribed to help treat post-radiation illnesses due to brain cancer. It healed the wounds in days. Medications make me very sensitive to sunlight and I burn easily. DMSO healed my 1st-2nd degree burns within 4-5 days. It caused my skin to peel faster, too. 

Don't put it on thick, or it may cause your skin to get red, raise a bit and swell with all it's forced to absorb, and if it's thick enough to drip, you'll have that red raised skin follow the drips. It does go away and didn't cause any injury, but it was uncomfortable. Just coat it enough to get your skin to glisten. The person that applied it enough to drip didn't know how to use it.

Also make sure your skin is clean and soap free of you'll find out what it's like to absorb soap. It does sting. Never use your fingers to apply it; use gloves, a cotton ball or a Q-Tip. Never "double dip" and contaminate the gel. It has no disinfectant properties, and it is possible to cross-contaminate that way. That's why if you use a roll-on stick, make sure only you use it and never share.

An elderly woman took a bad fall and scraped up her arm pretty badly. After an immediate application of DMSO after cleaning, her wound was gone in a matter of days. The skin of the elderly is very sensitive and fragile which makes it slower to heal, so this is remarkable!

Highly recommended among cancer patients, the elderly and healthy.

reviewer_info: jchamilt, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Consumer)
comment: I have been diagnosed with arthritis of the wrist and hand that has caused me much pain.  I started to apply 70% solution of DMSO to the area of the pain with an eye dropper and working it into the skin with the side of the glass eye dropper. I apply DMSO twice a day this way and got pain relief that has make it possible for me to do my normal activities that I could not do before.  The maximum pain relief came after 4 days of treatment.  Some people may think DMSO is like a placebo, the pain relief is only in the mind.  For myself I have proved this to not be the case.  When I have forgotten to use DMSO in the morning or evening the pain surprisingly comes back and then I remember I didn't use DMSO.  This product is so cheap that for $10 to $15 I can treat my pain for a year.  I now use it any time I have a pain and it seems to work.  I know this is hard to believe.  Side effects:  There might be a slight burning sensation when I apply it.  On a scale of 1 to 10 it is a 1 or less.  I have noticed a slight drying of the skin sometimes in the area of application.  Again something I wouldn't even notice if I wasn't applying it twice a day.  I have a few times noticed a garlic taste, but this rare for me.  I have been using this product as described for over 6 months and recommend it to others.  What I can't understand is why so many people comment positively on DMSO here on WebMD.  No one has anything to gain from promoting this product.  No one can make much money on this since it is only an industrial solvent. I have read many unbelievable stories about this and watched the 60 Minutes segment on YouTube.  This is for real.  Since no one can make any money on this, there is not money to do controlled clinical trials.  If you look at the studies that have been done the dosage is all over the map so no one knows what the right concentration / dose / or how many times a day DMSO should be applied.  My doctor said if it helps, use it.

reviewer_info: Trusting in God, 65-74 Female  (Consumer)
comment: I am 66 years old, diagnosed with SLE, Lupus, a connective tissue disorder many years ago. When almost on my deathbed, at age 45, from Lupus, I have remained in 'remission'21 years asymptomatic. I have learned that people, like myself, who have Rh Negative blood, have more copper than iron in their blood, so I have added a small amount of copper a few times a week. I have done best with: adding DHEA 25 mg daily (over 20 years now) IV Chelation and IV DMSO has done wonders for 21 years...12 each annually. I continue with a positive ANA and asymptomatic with no Rx. I go out of the country for the IV Chleation and IV DMSO as they know the correct minerals etc. to use in the IV.I also get a lot of direct sunshine.

reviewer_info: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Consumer)
comment: Have used DMSO over the years on many muscle and joint injuries, always with good results. Currently it is really helping with my spinal stenosis and arthritic lower back. I apply a 70% gel (with 30% aloe vera) twice a day along my lumbar region and along the sciatic nerves in the buttocks. This substantially reduces my pain and makes daily life possible. [Other good treatments are TENS machines and medicinal marijuana.] The only problem I have ever had with DMSO is skin irritation. Never use more than the 70% strength, and combining it with aloe vera is good. Using it too frequently on a daily basis, or using it on certain body parts (like the face) makes it more irritating. Hydrocortisone creme can help with the irritation, just apply it after the DMSO and dried and been absorbed (remember, it will carry into your body anything that comes in contact with it). Good luck and God bless.

reviewer_info: 18 wheels, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment: I had got bitten by a brown recluse 10 times because it was trapped in my pants.(don't ask).  Anyway, I went to a doctor who didn't really care.  He barely even looked at me and prescribed me some crap that didn't work.  So since my skin was slowly deteriorating by the hour and big holes were starting to form, I decided to try the DMSO on it.  I put a thick layer on each bite with either some gauze or a bandaid depending on the size of the hole.  When I woke up the next morning it had pulled most of the poison out of the gashes in my body.  It had stopped the seepage and I could tell it was working.  So I cleaned it up and put some more on there and when i checked it again later each bite looked completely rejuevinated.  the skin cells looked brand new.  It went from a dark blood red to a white and pink healthy look.  I could tell all the poison was out.  I kept using it until I got back home ( I'm a truck driver so I was out on the road)and saw my doctor.  She looked me over and told me that it was a miracle that they didn't have to perform a surgery on me because she had never had a brown recluse case that didn't require surgery to stop the poison from spreading. It literally can eat away at your flesh like a slow seeping acid.  Anyways, my mom said it worked on her scars.  I personally have never used it for that use but I think all doctor's should try this product on any kind of insect bite but especially on brown recluse bites. reviewer_info: shari, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
comment:
My 96 year old mother has been able to reduce her
medicines to just 3 of them plus vitamins.  She
takes 25 mg lovastatin, 2 baby asprin and 25 mg
sertraline.  I had been giving her CoQ 10 as well.
When I stopped for a few weeks her age-related and
post TIA-mini-stroke Dementia got much worse.  Her
thought processes and mind-body connections became
very impaired making it difficult to communicate
with her effectively and difficult for her to stand or walk a couple feet.  I started giving her
the CoQ 10 again, and it was amazing.  Within 48 hours her previous physical and mental abilities returned.  She can complete her sentences which are again coherent, she can understand what I say,
and she can stand up for 5 minutes, walk across the room and even play Scrabble with me.  Without
the CoQ 10 it had become so difficult to take care
of her at home over a 6-8 week period that I thought I would have to put her in a Care Home. 
I read that Lovastatin causes CoQ 10 deplepletion
(along with the aging process).  I was totally amazed how fast CoQ 10 worked to reverse the totally debilitating process that was getting worse and worse for my mother.  With CoQ 10 daily,
(and blueberries) my mother is 96 years YOUNG again.    I have learned the hard way (both for myself and my mother) that it is very important to
thoroughly research how one's medicines may be negatively interacting, (causing reduced or increased absorption or other side effects) and how some medicines can result vitamin and mineral
deficiencies.

reviewer_info: Lethe, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Consumer)
comment: This is more a question for the experts than a review.   I am a 60 year old female, and I have been taking co-Q-10 supplements daily for over 20 years.  I began taking it after reading a research paper that indicated that co-Q-10 might be effective in increasing immune response.  My whole life prior to that time, I was extremely susceptible to infections; if someone with the flu or a cold even looked at me across a room, I got sick.  I was constantly sick as a child, and as an adult suffered what seemed like a continuous cold throughout the winter, along with episodes of the flu, bronchitis, etc.  NOTHING helped, not dietary intervention, not the then-popular vitamin C dosage, nothing.  After several months of taking a combined dose of co-Q-10, vitamin E and lecithin (a cocktail suggested in the research paper), I noticed that I was not getting sick as often.  I have continued the same dosage since that time, and I have not had a single cold while taking it.  No colds, no flu, no bronchitis, nothing. I did suspend the dosage for several weeks two or three times, to see if it made a difference.  It did.  Caught a cold.  Started dosage again and returned to cold-free status. (I should note that after reading reports earlier this year that long-term dosage with vitamin E could be harmful, I discontinued the vitamin E portion of the cocktail.  I have not noticed any decrease in effectiveness).   So I am curious to know if there have been any further studies on this effect of co-Q-10.  Is it possible that this could be a placebo effect of such lasting duration?  What say you, experts?  Inquiring minds want to know. ^_^

I could see, however, experiencing some rather uncomfortable headaches and nausea if you are very toxic in your system and then slam in the Chlorella all of a sudden.

In my experience, it's the contaminated products that make people experience the harsh symptoms like nausea, vomiting, etc. As WebMD states in their own description of blue-green algae in general, "blue-green algae products that are contaminated are LIKELY UNSAFE...Contaminated blue-green algae can cause liver damage, stomach pain, nausea, vomiting, weakness, thirst, rapid heartbeat, shock, and death. Don’t use any blue-green algae product that hasn’t been tested and found free of mycrocystins and other contamination."

I guess others who wrote about having these symptoms might just be allergic rather than hitting upon a contaminated product, but for me, I've had no problems with the Yarrow Formulas so far. It has helped us all with our digestive system (from constipation to regularity) and has given us all a lot more energy and we are overall not getting sick with colds as much. My total cholesterol, LDL and triglyverides lowered a great deal (and I was already eating healthy and exercising!) There are many various brands of chlorella...look for the kinds that have the GMP label on them (Good Manufacturing Practices).  I also recommend you start off SLOW...If you take too much too soon it could possibly set off a bad reaction...as with anything.  You do not need a lot to have a positive effect.  Because it is expensive I use less than the directions and I have seen clinical benefits.

reviewer_info: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Consumer)
comment:
This doesn't give a reason of miscarriage or MTHFR as reasons for taking this treatment, but it's the real reason I did.  I had 6 miscarriages, 5 of which were consecutive after having had 3 healthy children.  I went to doctor after doctor finally being diagnosed with MTHFR.  After an RE recommended folic acid (which is NOT the same as methylfolate - 2 different forms of vitamin B9), I discovered that made things worse.  I did my own research and discovered methylfolate.  I took this and the very next pregnancy was carried to full term with a healthy baby as a result.  Not only that though - my chronic fatigue, depression, neurological issues, and memory loss all immediately and dramatically improved.

Folic acid is synthetic and cheap - but it is not what the body uses.  It has to convert it to methylfolate first.  For those of us with MTHFR polymorphisms, this process is either partially or completely broken.  Folic acid is not only useless to us, it is actually deadly.  I wish someone had told me years ago all I needed was a better vitamin B9!!

reviewer_info: aldag, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Consumer)
comment: For years I suffered from a small irritated skin lesion at the base of my nose only on the right hand side. It was intensely itchy for such a small area of skin irritation. The dermatologist prescribed a cortisone cream which worked, but when the cream was discontinued, the lesion and itching came right back. Then I read an article about skin rashes that were the result of low selenium. A doctor recommended eating two Brazil nuts per day to obtain selenium for this type of rash. So I tried this solution and much to my amazement within three days the itching stopped and by the end of a week the lesion had cleared. Then I substituted a yeast based supplement containing selenium for the Brazil nuts and the rash came right back within days. This result was perplexing. Then I tried a better grade supplement, Swanson Albion Complex Selenium and the rash cleared as it had with the Brazil nuts. So the type of selenium supplement makes a huge difference. I would suggest for an atopic dermatitis type rash that the selenium could be tried for possible improvement. Results would be known within the first week.
